summary: Carcinoid syndrome is a paraneoplastic syndrome comprising the signs and symptoms that occur secondary to neuroendocrine tumors. It is caused by these tumors releasing biologically active substances into the blood.
causes: Release of biologically active substances (serotonin, histamine, tachykinins, kallikrein, prostaglandins) by neuroendocrine tumors
Metastasis of neuroendocrine tumors to the liver allowing substances to bypass first pass metabolism
Neuroendocrine tumors arising in the bronchi releasing products into systemic circulation before liver metabolism
risk_factors: Neuroendocrine tumors that have metastasized to the liver
symptoms: Fibrosis of the tricuspid and pulmonic valves
diagnosis: Nuclear medicine gamma camera imaging (indium-111 pentetreotide)
treatments: Surgical valve repair or replacement (carcinoid heart disease)
